Eddie Lacy is Staying Lean This Offseason With Healthy Food and Pool Sprints Updated: February 22, 2017 STACK Performance Nutrition: Best Sources of Carbs for Athletes Views 1,652,566 STACK Performance Nutrition: How to Refuel After Exercise Views 443,950 STACK Performance Nutrition: Build A Better Plate Views 556,566 STACK Performance Nutrition: Best Sources of Protein for Athletes Views 459,457 J.J. Watt Talks Practicing Hard and Eating Right at Super Bowl XLVII Views 253,314 Wheaties Presents: Nutrition for Performance Views 1,509,987 Chris Mohr Talks Nutrition at Super Bowl XLVII Views 146,874 Maurice Jones-Drew Talks Nutrition at Super Bowl XLVII Leslie Bonci's Meals for Athletes Views 116,077 Tiki Barber Talks Post NFL Nutrition Views 190,797 Previous Next Green Bay Packers running back Eddie Lacy had another disappointing season in 2016. Due to a broken ankle, the 26-year-old played in only five games , accumulating 360 rushing yards and scoring no touchdowns. During the 2015 season, Lacy gained serious weight, which led to his worst full year in the league. But Lacy is trying to make 2017 his year—by staying lean this offseason. 
RELATED: Eddie Lacy Isn't Fat Anymore Thanks to P90X With an injured ankle, it would be easy for the one-time Pro Bowler to gain all the weight he lost for the 2016 season, but it looks like Lacy is working to keep it off. Recently, he showed himself performing Pool Sprints via social media. Not only is this exercise great for cardio, but it also doesn't aggravate his recovering ankle. 
— Eddie Lacy (@Lil_Eazy_Ana_42) February 21, 2017 
According to other posts, Lacy has not only been rehabbing his ankle, but also eating healthier since the injury. He is a free agent this year, so it's a smart tactic for him to show off his health. Judging from the video above and the photos below, he's looking good.
